intro: Dudleya collomiae, commonly known as the Santa Barbara Dudleya, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are often covered in a powdery coating. The plant produces vibrant orange or yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
